SourceAnalyzer.Name: Ordering Rules
SourceAnalyzer.Description: Rules which enforce a standard ordering scheme for code contents.

BooleanProperty.Name: GeneratedCodeElementOrder
BooleanProperty.Description: Indicates whether to enforce standard code ordering rules for blocks of generated code. It is only necessary to disable this setting if the project contains generated code which does not follow standard ordering rules, resulting in StyleCop violations.

Rule.Name: UsingDirectivesMustBePlacedWithinNamespace
Rule.Context: All using directives must be placed inside of the namespace.
Rule.Description: Validates that all using directives are placed within a namespace, if a namespace exists in the file unless used in an assembly attribute.

Rule.Name: ElementsMustAppearInTheCorrectOrder
Rule.Context: All {0} must be placed after all {1}.
Rule.Description: Validates that elements are placed in the correct order.

Rule.Name: ElementsMustBeOrderedByAccess
Rule.Context: All {0} {1} must be placed after all {2} {3}.
Rule.Description: Validates that elements of the same type are placed in order by access.

Rule.Name: ConstantsMustAppearBeforeFields
Rule.Context: All constants must be placed before all non-constants.
Rule.Description: Validates that all constant elements are placed before non-constant elements of the same type.

Rule.Name: StaticElementsMustAppearBeforeInstanceElements
Rule.Context: All static {0} {1} must be placed before all non-static {2} {3}.
Rule.Description: Validates that all static elements are placed before non-static elements of the same type.

Rule.Name: PartialElementsMustDeclareAccess
Rule.Context: The partial {0} does not have an access modifier defined. StyleCop may not be able to determine the correct placement of the elements in the file. Please declare an access modifier for all partial {1}.
Rule.Description: Validates that a partial element has a declared access modifier, which is necessary for determining the order of partial elements.

Rule.Name: DeclarationKeywordsMustFollowOrder
Rule.Context: The {0} keyword must come before the {1} keyword in the element declaration.
Rule.Description: Verifies the ordering of keywords in an element declaration.

Rule.Name: ProtectedMustComeBeforeInternal
Rule.Description: Verifies the ordering of the internal and protected keywords in an element with protected internal access.

Rule.Name: PropertyAccessorsMustFollowOrder
Rule.Context: A get-accessor within a property or indexer must be placed before a set-accessor.
Rule.Description: Verifies that get-accessors are placed before set-accessors within properties and indexers.

Rule.Name: EventAccessorsMustFollowOrder
Rule.Context: An add-accessor within an event must be placed before a remove-accessor.
Rule.Description: Verifies that add-accessors are placed before remove-accessors within events.

Rule.Name: StaticReadonlyElementsMustAppearBeforeStaticNonReadonlyElements
Rule.Context: All static readonly {0} {1} must be placed before all static non-readonly {2} {3}.
Rule.Description: Validates that all static readonly elements are placed before all static non-readonly elements of the same type.

Rule.Name: InstanceReadonlyElementsMustAppearBeforeInstanceNonReadonlyElements
Rule.Context: All non-static readonly {0} {1} must be placed before all non-static non-readonly {2} {3}.
Rule.Description: Validates that all non-static readonly elements are placed before non-static non-readonly elements of the same type.

Rule.Name: SystemUsingDirectivesMustBePlacedBeforeOtherUsingDirectives
Rule.Context: System using directives must be placed before all other using directives.
Rule.Description: Verifies that all using directives within the System namespace are placed before all other using directives.

Rule.Name: UsingAliasDirectivesMustBePlacedAfterOtherUsingDirectives
Rule.Context: Using alias directives must be placed after all using namespace directives.
Rule.Description: Verifies that all using alias directives are placed after all other using directives.

Rule.Name: UsingDirectivesMustBeOrderedAlphabeticallyByNamespace
Rule.Context: Using directives must be sorted alphabetically by the namespaces.
Rule.Description: Verifies that using directives are sorted alphabetically by the namespaces.

Rule.Name: UsingAliasDirectivesMustBeOrderedAlphabeticallyByAliasName
Rule.Context: Using alias directives must be sorted alphabetically by the alias names.
Rule.Description: Verifies that using alias directives are sorted alphabetically by the alias names.

Rule.Name: UsingStaticDirectivesMustBePlacedAtTheCorrectLocation
Rule.Context: Using static directives must be placed after using namespace directives.
Rule.Description: Verifies that all using static directives are placed after all using namespace directives.
